title: From Taoyuan airport(TPE) to every city or county
heroImageCredit: KCS, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
intro: Welcome to Taiwan! Taoyuan International Airport (TPE) is located in northern Taiwan. From here, you can easily reach any city. The most important rule: Once you check out, look for the MRT (Taoyuan Metro) immediately unless you are going to nearby Hsinchu or Taoyuan city center.

sections.heading: The Golden Rule: Check Out & Find the MRT
sections.content: After passing immigration, follow the signs to the Taoyuan Airport MRT. It connects Terminal 1 and Terminal 2 directly. This is your starting point for almost every destination.
sections.tip: The Purple Express train is faster (35 mins to Taipei), while the Blue Commuter train stops at every station.

sections.heading: Heading North or East (Taipei, Keelung, Yilan, Hualien)
sections.content:
To reach Taipei City, take the Airport MRT to A1 Taipei Main Station. From there, you can transfer to the Taipei Metro (MRT) to reach hotels in Ximending, Xinyi District, or Shilin.

If you are going to Keelung, Yilan, or Hualien, transfer to the TRA (Train) at Taipei Main Station.

sections.heading: Heading South (Taichung, Tainan, Kaohsiung)
sections.content:
To travel south, take the Airport MRT to A18 Taoyuan HSR Station. From here, you can take the Taiwan High Speed Rail (THSR) to the following major cities:

  • Hsinchu
  • Miaoli
  • Taichung (Major Hub)
  • Changhua
  • Yunlin
  • Chiayi (Gateway to Alishan)
  • Tainan
  • Kaohsiung (Zuoying Station)

sections.tip: If you buy a Non-Reserved ticket, you can only sit in cars 10-12. If you want a guaranteed seat, buy a Reserved ticket.

sections.heading: Nearby Cities: Taoyuan City Center, Zhongli & Hsinchu
sections.content: For destinations close to the airport, buses are often more direct. For Taoyuan City Center (Bus 706) or Zhongli (Bus 5089), head to the bus station. For Hsinchu, many travelers also prefer the direct bus (Route 1250) to avoid the transfer at the HSR station.
